intro: Antirrhinum murale proles linkianum, commonly known as the wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plantaginaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers that typically come in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant produces tubular or spurred flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found growing on rocky or sunny slopes.
